images.copyright: Fireworks during La Mercè Festival in Barcelona, Spain (© Lucas Vallecillos/age fotostock)
images.title: Barcelona bids farewell to summer
images.caption: Barcelona bids farewell to summer
images.desc: Every year, for four days in September, locals and tourists flock to one of Barcelona’s biggest events, La Mercè Festival. It got its beginnings in 1687 when Barcelona was suffering from a plague of locusts. In desperation, city officials voted to ask for the assistance of La Mare de Déu de la Mercè (the Virgin of Mercy). Eventually, having been delivered from the pestilence, the officials named the Virgin of Mercy the patroness of Barcelona, and an annual festival has been celebrated in her honor in the city ever since.
